SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Inability to speak during emotional excitement
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Fear, anticipation, or nervousness blocks voice
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Gelsemium – exam anxiety; Argent-nit – stage fright

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: After fright, stroke, or sudden shock
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Causticum – post-paralytic aphonia

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Often jumps from one topic to another
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Lachesis – nonstop talking, especially in evening

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: During delirium, mania, or mental confusion
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Cannabis – loses thread of thought mid-sentence

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Worse from anxiety or being watched
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Often seen in timid or developmentally delayed children

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Mental dullness, fatigue, or fear
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Baryta – childish, bashful speech patterns

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Often occurs in delirium or OCD states
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Stramonium – compulsive repetition in psychosis

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Answers slowly or not at all
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Apathetic, dazed, or dull mental state
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Opium – answers slowly, inattentive

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Speech confused during fever or delirium
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: High temperature or cerebral inflammation
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Belladonna – muttering with red face and dryness

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Sadness, grief, or introversion
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Nat mur – introverted grief pattern

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Worse in morning or evening; overuse of voice
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Causticum – classic for morning hoarseness

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Worse after exposure, anger, or over-talking
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Causticum – cannot speak a word though tries

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Even whisper is exhausting
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Voice fades with talking – key in Phosphorus

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice cracks or breaks while talking
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Worse when speaking continuously
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Phosphorus – emotional or weak nerves

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Chronic laryngitis or endocrine issues
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Seen in elderly or thyroid-based cases

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Often in children, hysteria, or high fever
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Chamomilla – especially in irritable children

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice lost after anger or grief
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Silent after emotional suppression
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Ignatia – silent grief, aphonia from emotion

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice lost after exposure to cold air
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Dry, cold wind or sudden chill
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Common in acute laryngitis

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Even few words start violent cough
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Drosera – cough triggered by voice, very sensitive

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Hoarseness or aphonia before/during menses
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Lachesis – all symptoms worse during menses

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice changes during emotion or excitement
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Grief, stage fright, anger causes hoarseness or loss
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Voice trembles or vanishes during stress

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice lost after singing or overuse
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Professional voice strain or overtalking
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Arg-met – classic for singers, public speakers

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice lost or weak in the morning
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Wakes aphonic or very hoarse
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Morning aphonia is a keynote of Causticum

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice lost after suppression of eruption or menses
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Skin suppression or menstrual suppression history
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Deep miasmatic block; Causticum highly indicated

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Weakness, anxiety, exam fear
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Gelsemium – trembling voice, lack of confidence

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice croaking, as if speaking through mucus
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Worse in morning or in damp cold
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Kali bich – thick sticky mucus in larynx

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice squeaky or childish in adults
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Underdeveloped larynx or delayed growth
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Baryta – physical + emotional immaturity

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Sudden aphonia mid-sentence
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Causticum – paralysis-like sudden loss

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice better after drinking cold water
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Soothes burning or dryness in larynx
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Confirmatory for Phosphorus

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Voice deep, hoarse, harsh in children
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: During croup, laryngitis, or cold exposure
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Spongia – barking hoarse croupy voice

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Talks loudly or mutters; reveals secrets or emotions
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Lachesis – passionate talk during sleep; Bell – fever talk

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Talking in delirium with eyes open
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: High fever, meningeal states, red face
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Bell – classic red face, dry tongue, muttering

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Talks irrationally or about imaginary things
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: During psychosis, mania, or high fever
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Cann-ind – fantastic stories mid-sentence

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: In delirium, mania, dementia
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Shows disconnected mental processing

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Even answering increases head pain
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Bryonia – wants to lie still and silent

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Developmental delay or post-stroke
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Speech defect in children or after paralysis

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Inability to articulate after fright or grief
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Paralytic or mental block after emotional trauma
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Gelsemium – cannot speak in front of audience

SpeechVoicePatterns.rubric: Talks with closed eyes in semi-sleep
SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: Dreamy, in twilight consciousness
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Often part of fever or hysteria states

SpeechVoicePatterns.modality: From weakness, fear, or laryngeal paresis
SpeechVoicePatterns.notes: Stannum – weakness of voice from slightest effort
